module_restrictions:
1) NUPACE Special Undergraduate and Special Graduate Students majoring in Chemistry or Physics are generally not permitted to enrol in G30 courses with laboratory content.

2) Students wishing to apply for clerkships at the School of Medicine should carefully follow application notes and instructions on the NUPACE website.

Students must possess the prerequisite for the courses they are planning to read. If students plan to read courses taught in Japanese, they must possess N1/level 1 of the Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT), or the equivalent.
visa_info:
Upon acceptance, Nagoya will apply for a Certificate of Eligibility on your behalf with the Japanese Ministry of Justice, and send it to you when issued. The certificate is required for you to apply for a study visa.

Exchange students must obtain a “College Student” visa for the duration of their study in Japan. Please visit the Japan Embassy website for the required supporting documents for your visa application.

All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university. This is to ensure that you can obtain your visa in time before the start of your exchange term. Your exchange at the host university depends on the clearance by the immigration of the host country.
accommodations_info: All successful applicants are housed in single rooms in student dormitories, located either on-campus or close to the university. Approximately JP¥25,000 - JP¥45,000 per month, including utilities. NUPACE will apply for housing on the students’ behalf.
cost_of_living:
The estimated monthly living expenses are as follows:

- Accommodation: JP¥25,000 - JP¥45,000
- Food: JP¥20,000 - JP¥30,000
- Insurance: JP¥2,000
- Others (Entertainment, clothes): JP¥30,000

The monthly estimate ranges from JP¥77,000 - JP¥107,000. For more details, please refer to http://nupace.iee.nagoya-u.ac.jp/en/life/financial.html.
